strDesc: [us] flicks through the local social networks on their PDA.
[us] pulls up their schedule and updates their to-do list.
[us] pauses to add a line to a long letter home on their PDA.
[us] loads the [them] with a coffee puck.
The [us] emits a jet of coffee flavoured water into [them]'s canteen.
[us] savours the first sip of coffee.
Something inside the housing whirrs, then grinds, then fizzles. [them] sighs. The damned [us] is on the fritz again.
[us] hits the bloody [them] to get it to work again.
The [us] shudders and sputters, drooling liquid. It's still broken.
[us] flips open the [them]'s housing and sets about fixing it.
The [us] begins working again, and [them] jams their canteen in the socket in the nick of time.
Something inside the [us] crunches pitifully, suggesting that the [us] is now broken beyond immediate repair.
[us] throws up their hands. Coffee isn't happening. Everyone had better stay out of their way.
[us] steps aside, to make room for [them].
[us] notices [them]'s state and offers to cover the rest of their shift.
[us] shakes their head and waves [them] away.
[us] grows a little agitated, and stamps their butt under foot.
[us] accepts the cigarette and [them]'s offered light.
[us]'s conversation falters, and ends with [us] and [them] in silent reflection, puffing away.
[us] and [them] enjoy their smoking session in a comfortable silence.
[us] waves the offered Viceroy away. It's not their brand.
[us] slow claps while shaking their head, then turns away.
[us] points out afeature of the ship's subsystems to [them], demonstrating their technical expertise.
[us] tells [them] to spare them the details. Who cares?
Not to be outdone, [us] fires back using even more esoteric technical jargon.
[us] guffaws, telling another story they're reminded of.
[us] banters with [them] about a recent Breakout match.
[us] re-enacts a play from the last game, hurling an imaginary ball to [them].
[us] and [them] reminisce about how the Shooters destroyed the Warriors.'
[us] gloats to [them] about how the Warriors destroyed [them]'s precious Shooters.
[us] catches the ball. Dipping and juking, they beat three defenders and shoot at a bulkhead for the goal.
[us] admits that they haven't watched Breakout in a while.
[us] asks if [them] would like to get a drink.
[us] shrugs and tells [them] to lead the way.
[us] lets out a surprised burst of laughter.
[us] cautions [them] for not observing the rules of a spacer superstition.
[us] curses, and makes a gesture to avert bad luck.
[us] scoffs that it's all a bunch of nonsense.
[us] takes a deep breath, and nods.
[us] opens up to [them] with their insecurities.
[us] tells [them] it's all in their head, and not to worry.
[us] asks why [them] has to burden others with their problems.
[us] accuses [them] of hiring their ex-lover so they can sleep with them.
[us] claims they're already spoken for, so no worries.
[us] pretends this isn't happening now and starts talking about something else...
[us] reiterates to [them] that this discussion is happening NOW.
[us] says damn right they will! Can't wait!
[us] scoffs. Not that ugly ho. Eew!
[us] explains they can't prove it, since their lover lives in Old Canada.
[us] scoffs. A likely story. [us] asks [them] to prove it.
[us] pauses, puzzled in thought a moment...
[us] mutters to themselves, something about you being sorry.
[us] tells [them] to calm down and take a breath.
[us]'s sees [them] and their eyes narrow. "Hey you!"
[us] looks at [them], puzzled, then shakes their head. They don't sign-on with complete strangers.
[us] tells [them] to stuff it. Nobody's gonna tell them what to do anymore.
[us] says nobody respects them, so no way.
[us] says no way, no how. Too dangerous.
[us] says they'd just bring the ship down anyway. So no.
[us] tells [them] to take this job and shove it. Nobody's gonna tell them what to do anymore.
[us] says nobody respects them, so they quit.
[us] says the job is too dangerous. They're out.
[us] says they're just bringing the ship down anyway. So they quit.
[us] reiterates the urgency of the situation to [them].
[us] repeats what [them] just said, but sexually.
[us] answers [them] to the best of their own recollection.
[us] doesn't outright lie, but neither is the truth exactly foregrounded.
[us] thinks [them] is hiding something, and the questioning grows more pointed.
[us] casually hints that maybe [them] should bribe them.
